alert.note: Alert for Lafayette; Marshall; Panola; Tate (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 10:01AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Lafayette, southern Marshall, southern Tate and northeastern Panola Counties through 1100 AM CDT... At 1000 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Senatobia, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Oxford, Senatobia, Water Valley, Holly Springs National Forest, John W Kyle State Park, Sardis, Coldwater, Como, Barr, Cambridge, Harmontown, Springdale, Burgess, Laws Hill, Paris, Abbeville, Taylor, Malone, Keel and Aiken. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
